content.p: Image of a young girl holding a paint brush ‘Understanding FGM’ (Female genital mutilation) is a new RLO developed by the HELM team in conjunction with the Mojatu Foundation. The resource was developed following workshops with survivors of FGM, where brave women shared their experiences through drawing, clay modelling and poems. The narrative of the resource was guided by academic experts; Julie McGarry, Kathryn Hinsliff-Smith, Natasha Recchia & Catrin Evans. The resource is released in memory of Valentine Nkoyo, Director of the Mojatu Foundation. A link to the Understanding FGM resource can be found here. School of Health Sciences B310, B Floor, South Block Link Queen's Medical Centre Nottingham, NG7 2UH email: helm@nottingham.ac.uk
